results.title: Reduction by beta-adrenoceptor blockade of hypoxia-induced right heart hypertrophy in the rat.
results.text_hl: Treatment with the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta 1-adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, in a dose of 80 mg kg-1 body weight abolished @<m>DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Right_Ventricular</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017380 @@@right ventricular hypertrophy@@@ in response to 7% inspired @CHEMICAL_Oxygen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010100 @@@oxygen@@@, without affecting haematocrit and caused a small reduction in the ratio of heart weight to body weight in normoxic @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@. 6.

citations.NLM: Ostman-Smith I. Reduction by beta-adrenoceptor blockade of hypoxia-induced right heart hypertrophy in the rat. Br J Pharmacol. 1995 Nov;116(6):2698-702. PMID: 8590992
citations.BibTeX: @article{8590992, title={Reduction by beta-adrenoceptor blockade of hypoxia-induced right heart hypertrophy in the rat.}, author={Ostman-Smith I}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={116}, number={6}, pages={2698-702}}
